pkgmetadata.longdescription: Cryptographic Hash and Extendable-Output Functions // Fast and memory-efficient streaming hash functions. Performs direct hashing of strings, raw bytes, and files potentially larger than memory, as well as hashing in-memory objects through R's serialization mechanism, without requiring allocation of the serialized object. Implementations include the SHA-256 and SHA-3 cryptographic hash functions, SHAKE256 extendable-output function (XOF), and 'SipHash' pseudo-random function. The SHA-3 Secure Hash Standard was published by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in 2015 at doi:10.6028/NIST.FIPS.202. The SHA-256 Secure Hash Standard was published by NIST in 2002 at https://csrc.nist.gov/publications /fips/fips180-2/fips180-2.pdf.
